title: Request data validation before account creation
description:
## Problem statement
Being **ActivateAccountKey** an open endpoint, anyone can call this with random information. If someone sends **d**, **an**, **e** together a valid cres account will be created and value of **e** will be admin of that account. For more information check [CLOUDCRES-1480]( or [wiki](

## Solution
With this change CRES is expecting an extra parameter **ot**, which gets generated by CRES while Atlas makes request to store account information. The information shared by Atlas gets added to **T_DEVICE** table, later the same is compared with the help of **ot**. If both the values matches then account gets created or request gets rejected with error **`Invalid one time token`**.

## Dependencies
With help of addin-server change information gets stored in **T_DEVICE** table while CES makes request to store account information.
addin-server changes: 

## Test procedures
##### Usecase 1
An entry with token **`dd/WnPwoyDhVcPksIY2MQaOhXWGrX5SQ`** is there in **T_DEVICE** table 
**Request**
`curl --location ' --header 'Host: localhost:8080'`

**Response**
```
status=0
message=
activateData=data%40id%3D100000029%26aId%3D1000015%26name%3DToken1000015%26desc%3DDefault+Token%26value%3DHGUYWgqszdOrJm7snSKj2jQudCr5zYee
hash=MczhFgOhNykgDAdbcfm8BogvwhE%3D
```

##### Usecase 2
There is no entry with token **`dd/WnPwoyDhVcPksIY2MQaOhXWGrX5S1`** is there in **T_DEVICE** table 
**Request**
`curl --location ' --header 'Host: localhost:8080'`

**Response**
```
status=1
message=Invalid%20license%20key.
```

## Before
Account gets created with invalid information(account name, email address, ESA serial number).

## After
Account will not be created with invalid information(account name, email address, ESA serial number).

title: [Pentest-Fix] removed session attribute from index.jsp file
description:
Earlier, after logging into the admin panel, it was possible to access session information by using the "view page source" feature, which posed a security risk as user sessions could potentially be compromised. So I have removed the session attribute from the index.jsp file. We dont need Session Token value here.

JIRA: 

Use of no script
`The <noscript> tag defines an alternate content to be displayed to users that have disabled scripts in their browser or have a browser that doesn't support script.`


Text Displayed when JS is disabled - 
(attachment:2199/9601)

title: CSCwh12984: Integration with Atlas
description:
## Problem statement
Account provision request content(esa serial no, account name, email address) was not validated for CES customers. As being an open endpoint it was open for attack. Anyone can create an account by sending the required no of parameters. For more information check [CLOUDCRES-1623](

## Solution
With this change ESA serial no on the request will be validated by calling Atlas API. If Serial number is known to CES then only account will be created or else request will be rejected. [Atlas API wiki](
(attachment:2199/9507) 

## Dependencies
Values needs to be added in `.pxerc`
`CFG_CES_URL` CES url (default value is set to ``)
`CFG_CES_USERNAME` CES username (default value is set to `atlas_service_qa.gen`)
`CFG_CES_PASSWORD` CES password (no default value)

## Test procedures
**correct serial number**
```
curl -H 'dev.res.cisco.com' ' -v
```

**Response**
status=0
message=
activateData=data%40id%3D10004%26aId%3D102%26name%3DToken102%26desc%3DDefault+Token%26value%3DmqY0qwcaV0jmL6E5uwtjE8bJLIT9kNyB
hash=vks0xvoHodwjPwjKQASXCvfHSPQ%3D


**same serial number as before**
```
curl -H 'dev.res.cisco.com' ' -v
```

**Response**
status=0
message=
activateData=data%40id%3D10004%26aId%3D102%26name%3DToken102%26desc%3DDefault+Token%26value%3DmqY0qwcaV0jmL6E5uwtjE8bJLIT9kNyB
hash=vks0xvoHodwjPwjKQASXCvfHSPQ%3D


**invalid serial addition to AVIJIT20101**
```
curl -H 'dev.res.cisco.com' ' -v
```

**Response**
status=3
message=There%20is%20no%20account%20present%20on%20CES%20with%20given%20license%20key%20and%2For%20account%20name


**new serial addition to AVIJIT20101**
```
curl -H 'dev.res.cisco.com' ' -v
```

**Response**
status=0
message=
activateData=data%40id%3D10004%26aId%3D102%26name%3DToken102%26desc%3DDefault+Token%26value%3DmqY0qwcaV0jmL6E5uwtjE8bJLIT9kNyB
hash=vks0xvoHodwjPwjKQASXCvfHSPQ%3D

## Before
Anyone can create a CRES account by sending required no of arguments to the above endpoint.

## After
Request with valid ESA serial no will be able to create an account.

title: [MUST to review before Nov 8th]Bugfix/CSCwc56770 spring framework upgrade
description:
* commented  dependencies from build and lib-depends
* spring beans 5.3.30
* spring core depedency added 5.3.30
* bean definition update
* spring oxm and spring web 5.3.30 upgrade
 * SPEL 5.3.30 upgrade
* dead code jar dependency removed
* 
**US** 
**CDETS** 
 CSCwc56770-   CIAM: spring-framework - multiple versions(CVE-2022-22970)
 ,CSCwe85829-Vulnerabilities in spring-framework 3.1.3.RELEASE CVE-2023-20861
**US **

**CDETS**
CSCwb50243- CIAM: spring-framework 4.3.4 and spring-framework 3.1.3 CVE-2022-22950
upgrading `spring-expression-5.3.30.jar`for this CVE-2022-22950
 Overall 20 spring framework jars. Among 3 identified as not in use jars . hence deleted those from repo .
 spring-aop.jar,org.springframework.web.portlet-3.1.3.RELEASE.jar and org.springframework.web.struts-3.1.3.RELEASE.jar 

 And the two reported CVE's CVE-2022-22970 and CVE-2023-20861 are applicable for 4 jars as below 
  spring-beans.jar 
  spring-core.jar 
  spring-oxm.jar and
  spring-web.jar
  
** NOTE** Upgraded these jars from 3.1.3-RELEASE to 5.3.30 .
  Jars downloaded from 
  Even though  spring 6.0.13 is the most recent released version ,  upgrading to  this failed as we use JDK 8 in pxall. "Spring 5.3. x has long-term support provided on JDK 8, JDK 11 & JDK 17"
 
  
   
**external PR** 

**Validation**
1.build and deployment success.
2.Websafe and admin login works fine
3.Compose message encryption is fine
4.REply /ReplyAll/fwd flow works fine
5.Decryption flow validated
Plan is to run the automation as its a overall framework change

title: [Nov 11th HPS] Corrected the logic for saml response parsing
description:
Earlier, we were parsing every password / saml response as XML saml response. This caused logging of exceptions when trying to parse simple passwords as XML. This parsing was required only when saml was the authentication method. Hence, there is a change in the logic "when to parse the response as XML?"

(attachment:2199/9403) 
As you can see, there are no exceptions while logging into websafe/admin/securedoc

**Both cres and saml login for websafe, admin and securedoc have been tested and no exceptions were seen.**

title: [Nov 4 th release]  [bugfix] Changed SecureRandom.getInstance(name) to SecureRandom.getInstanceStrong()
description:
CDET: #view=CSCwh12967
getInstanceStrong() and getInstance() are methods that return a SecureRandom object. The getInstanceStrong() method ensures that a strong algorithm is used.

Basic Testing - Websafe, Mails, Admin checked
Ant SDK Tests also successful
